text.p: Here are highlights of stories reported by Hungary's press, based on information by Nepszabadsag's Hungary Around the Clock service. For further details on how to subscribe to Hungary Around the Clock, please contact Monica Kovacs at (361) 351 7142 or fax your request to (361) 351 7141.
ALL PAPERS

- The cabinet Thursday decided the mode of implementing a debt swap between the National Bank of Hungary and the central budget, cabinet spokesman Elemer Kiss said. The cabinet also approved a report on transforming the public health sector and decided to increase the base capital of broadcaster Antenna Hungaria.
- Christian Democratic Party president Gyorgy Giczy yesterday invited the presidents of the Young Democrats, the Smallholders and the Democratic Forum for top-level consultations.
- The National Customs and Excise Office (VPOP) took in record revenues last year, VPOP head Mihaly Arnold said.

- A total of 260 company managers representing 63 Japanese companies in Hungary are attending a conference organised by the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Tourism, ITDH and the Japanese Foreign Trade Organisation (Jetro) in Budapest.
- Shares of canning factory Globus will be introduced onto the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, perhaps as early as next Friday.
- The head of the special police unit that raided the wrong house early Monday resigned yesterday, acknowledging his moral responsibility for the error.
VILAGGAZDASAG

- Some 300 representatives of various Hungarian government and economic agencies are expected in Parliament today for a conference entitled Public Security '97, initiated by Prime Minister Gyula Horn.
NEPSZAVA
- This paper today produces a flowchart outlining the fate of lawyer Marta Tocsik's HUF 804 million commission fee received from the State Privatisation and Holding Co.
- The Free Democrats' executive body voted unanimously to terminate the post of party director Ferenc Wekler.
MAGYAR HIRLAP

- The Young Democrats presidential board yesterday called on Premier Gyula Horn to allow parliamentary group leaders to study the minutes recorded at the bilateral secret negotiations related to the Gabcikovo and Nagymaros hydropower plants.
- The State Debt Management Centre will launch a five-year government bond onto the market next Thursday.
- Shares of securities trading company Questor are expected to be introduced onto the stock exchange in the first half of March, said managing director Zsolt Mayer.
- A new outbreak of influenza has already taken the lives of three elderly persons in Tatabanya.
NEPSZABADSAG
- The National Bank of Hungary will register the Czech koruna and the Polish zloty in one or two months.
NAPI GAZDASAG

- The State Privatisation and Holding Co. will send out invitations today for the closed tender for 61 percent of Takarekbank. Invited parties include GiroCredit, Osterreichische Volksbank, Deutsche Genossenschaftsbank, Credit Agricole and Desjardins.
- This paper gives a more detailed information on economic data for November.
- The telecoms company Westel 900 GSM posted profits of nearly HUF 5 billion last year, up from HUF 900 milion in 1995.
-- Budapest newsroom (36 1) 327 4040
